title: Al Kharid

properties.name: description
properties.value: Al Kharid (also spelt Al-Kharid) is a city in the north of the Kharidian Desert. It is the only desert city open to non-members, and players in the city do not suffer from the desert effect. Al Kharid is ruled by the Emir, although the vast majority of the work has been taken over by Chancellor Hassan since the Emir's son was kidnapped.

Al Kharid

Al Kharid
The music which plays when inside Al Kharid

Al Kharid (also spelt Al-Kharid) is a city in the north of the Kharidian Desert. It is the only desert city open to non-members, and players in the city do not suffer from the desert effect. Al Kharid is ruled by the Emir, although the vast majority of the work has been taken over by Chancellor Hassan since the Emir's son was kidnapped.

This city is particularly useful to powerminers because of the nearby Mining area, which contains tin, copper, iron, silver, gold, mithril, adamantite, and coal rocks.

Travel[edit | edit source]

TRAVEL MAP: See where you need to be and the best way to get there with this visual travel map of the deserts.
Border Guards at the Al Kharid gate.
  • From Lumbridge, use the toll gate which costs either 10 coins, or if you have completed the Prince Ali Rescue quest, the gate is free.
  • From Varrock, go south via the road alongside the Al Kharid mine.
  • Members that have completed The Grand Tree quest can use the gnome glider to travel to and from Al Kharid.
  • Members can also use a ring of dueling to teleport to the Duel Arena, just north-east of Al Kharid.
  • Members can use an amulet of glory to teleport inside the palace, on the ground floor[UK]1st floor[US] in the southern room.
  • Members can also get to Al Kharid via the one-way fairy ring from Zanaris' market area.
  • Members can also come from the south via the Shantay Pass.
  • Members can use the level 8 Agility shortcut to get to and from Lumbridge Swamp.

Al Kharid contains the closest bank to a range as well as two reasonably close fishing spots. It also houses a tanner, Ellis. In free-to-play RuneScape, Al Kharid's furnace is the second-closest to a bank, after Edgeville's furnace.

Bank[edit | edit source]

Main article: Bank

Al Kharid's bank is to the south-west of the city. The bank is populated largely by craftsmen, smiths and chefs, largely due to the proximity of the tanner, range and furnace. In the free worlds, it often has many players buying and selling cowhides.

Shops[edit | edit source]

Zeke's Superior Scimitars[edit | edit source]

Zeke's Superior Scimitars
Main article: Zeke's Superior Scimitars

The scimitar shop is north-east of the bank.

Stocks:

  • 5 Bronze scimitars
  • 3 Iron scimitars
  • 2 Steel scimitars
  • 1 Mithril scimitar

You can also ask for a dragon scimitar. If you do this, Zeke makes several puns regarding the Monkey Madness I quest required to buy a dragon scimitar: "The banana-brained nitwits who make them would never sell any to me. Seriously, you'll be a monkey's uncle before you hold a Dragon Scimitar."

Dommik's Crafting Store.[edit | edit source]

Dommik's Crafting Store.
Main article: Dommik's Crafting Store.

The Crafting store is north-east of the palace.

Stocks:

  • 10 Chisels
  • 10 Ring moulds
  • 10 Necklace moulds
  • 10 Amulet moulds
  • 3 Needles
  • 100 Thread
  • 10 Holy moulds
  • 10 Sickle moulds
  • 10 Tiara moulds
  • 10 Bolt moulds
  • 10 Bracelet moulds

Al-Kharid General Store[edit | edit source]

Al-Kharid General Store
Main article: Al-Kharid General Store

The general store is east of the palace.

Stocks:

  • 5 Pots
  • 2 Jugs
  • 5 Empty jug packs
  • 2 Shears
  • 3 Buckets
  • 2 Bowls
  • 2 Cake tins
  • 3 Tinderboxes
  • 2 Chisels
  • 5 Hammers
  • 5 Newcomer maps
  • 5 Security book

The shop is also often well-stocked with recently crafted leather armour.

Louie's Armoured Legs Bazaar[edit | edit source]

Louie's Armoured Legs Bazaar
Main article: Louie's Armoured Legs Bazaar

The plateleg store is south of the general store, east of the palace.

Stocks:

  • 5 Bronze platelegs
  • 3 Iron platelegs
  • 2 Steel platelegs
  • 1 Black platelegs
  • 1 Mithril platelegs
  • 1 Adamant platelegs

Ranael's Super Skirt Store[edit | edit source]

Ranael's Super Skirt Store
Main article: Ranael's Super Skirt Store

The plateskirt store is east of the palace.

Stocks:

  • 5 Bronze plateskirts
  • 3 Iron plateskirts
  • 2 Steel plateskirts
  • 1 Black plateskirt
  • 1 Mithril plateskirt
  • 1 Adamant plateskirt

This shop stocks identical merchandise to Louie's Armoured Legs Bazaar, except the armour is plateskirts, not platelegs.

Kebab shop[edit | edit source]

The kebab shop is at the range directly north of the bank, a kebab can be bought for 1 coin here. Karim is the kebab seller.

Gem Trader[edit | edit source]

Gem Trader
Main article: Gem Trader

The Gem Trader is to the north of Al Kharid, east of the gate to Lumbridge.

Stock:

  • 1 Uncut sapphires
  • 1 Uncut emeralds
  • 0 Uncut rubies
  • 0 Uncut diamonds
  • 1 Sapphires
  • 1 Emeralds
  • 0 Rubies
  • 0 Diamonds

Silk trader[edit | edit source]

The silk trader near the scimitar shop is a quick and easy way for newer members to gain small amounts of money. If the player is prepared to click through a lengthy dialogue, they can buy silk cheaply (3 coins) which can be sold for a profit at a general store other than the one in Al Kharid.

Note: If you refuse at the first time, he'll lower the price to 2 coins.

Ali's Discount Wares.[edit | edit source]

Ali's Discount Wares.
Main article: Ali's Discount Wares.

Ali Morrisane is found east of the gem trader to the north-east of the city near the blue star quest icon . He sells various items, and once The Feud is completed, he will open various other shops if you set up merchanting opportunities for him.

Talk to him (there is no 'trade' option) and select the "Ya, I'll get to it soon." option. When he asks "...Unless you want to make a small purchase from me first?", select "Ok".

Sorceress's Garden[edit | edit source]

Main article: Sorceress's Garden

The Sorceress's Garden is found in the south-east of Al Kharid.

Al Kharid mine[edit | edit source]

Main article: Al Kharid mine

The Al Kharid mine is found near the northern entrance to Al Kharid.

Duel Arena[edit | edit source]

Main article: Duel Arena

The Duel Arena is found north-east of Al Kharid.

Clan Wars[edit | edit source]

Main article: Clan Wars

Clan Wars was previously found east of Al Kharid, but has since moved to Ferox Enclave. In its place is Citharede Abbey. This includes a mine and 8 desert variant hillgiants.

Miscellaneous features[edit | edit source]

  • There is a cactus patch on the east side of the city, used in the Farming skill.
  • The Fire Altar, used in the Runecraft skill is located just north of the Duel Arena
  • There is a furnace north of the bank. It is the fifth closest furnace to a bank in all of RuneScape.

Quests[edit | edit source]

The following Quests can be started in Al Kharid:

Free-to-play quests[edit | edit source]

  • Prince Ali Rescue may be started by speaking to Chancellor Hassan, who is in the southern room of the palace next to the bank.

Members quests[edit | edit source]

  • Shadow of the Storm may be started by speaking to Father Reen who is standing south of the bank.
  • The Feud may be started by speaking to Ali Morrisane at his stall.

Monsters[edit | edit source]

  • Al-Kharid warrior
  • Men and women
  • Scorpions

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
16 July 2020
(update)

Clan wars has been moved from the hill east of Al Kharid to Ferox Enclave.

19 June 2014
(update | poll)

Clan Wars is added east of Al Kharid.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Al Kharid is likely a reference to Al-Khali, a similar fantasy-Arabian town, from Terry Pratchett's Discworld novels.
  • There was no bank in Al Kharid until the release of Members on 27 February 2002

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Tip.it "More news about Update !!!"

{{*}} [[Ring of dueling]] ([[Duel Arena]]) |map = {{Map|name=Al Kharid|x=3292|y=3193|height=425|width=300|zoom=2}} |type = settlement }} {{Listen |title = Al Kharid |desc = The music which plays when inside Al Kharid |filename = Al Kharid.ogg }} '''Al Kharid''' (also spelt ''Al-Kharid'') is a city in the north of the [[Kharidian Desert]]. It is the only desert city open to [[Free-to-play|non-members]], and players in the city do not suffer from the [[Desert heat|desert effect]]. Al Kharid is ruled by [[the Emir]], although the vast majority of the work has been taken over by [[Hassan|Chancellor Hassan]] since the Emir's son was kidnapped. This city is particularly useful to powerminers because of the nearby [[Mining]] [[Al Kharid mine|area]], which contains [[Tin rock|tin]], [[Copper rock|copper]], [[Iron rock|iron]], [[Silver rock|silver]], [[Gold rock|gold]], [[Mithril rock|mithril]], [[Adamantite rock|adamantite]], and [[coal rock]]s. ==Travel== [[File:Kharidian Desert travel map.png|none|thumb|674x674px|TRAVEL MAP: See where you need to be and the best way to get there with this visual travel map of the deserts.]] [[File:Pay-toll.png|thumb|300px|[[Border Guard]]s at the Al Kharid gate.]] *From [[Lumbridge]], use the toll gate which costs either 10 [[coins]], or if you have completed the [[Prince Ali Rescue]] [[Quests|quest]], the gate is free. *From [[Varrock]], go south via the road alongside the [[Al Kharid mine]]. *[[Members]] that have completed [[The Grand Tree]] quest can use the [[gnome glider]] to travel to and from Al Kharid. *Members can also use a [[ring of dueling]] to [[teleport]] to the [[Duel Arena]], just north-east of Al Kharid. *Members can use an [[amulet of glory]] to teleport inside the palace, on the {{FloorNumber|uk=0}} in the southern room. *Members can also get to Al Kharid via the one-way fairy ring from [[Zanaris]]' market area. *Members can also come from the south via the [[Shantay Pass]]. *Members can use the level 8 [[Agility]] [[shortcut]] to get to and from [[Lumbridge Swamp]]. Al Kharid contains the closest [[bank]] to a [[range]] as well as two reasonably close [[fishing spots]]. It also houses a [[tanner]], [[Ellis]]. In [[free-to-play]] ''[[Old School RuneScape|RuneScape]]'', Al Kharid's [[furnace]] is the second-closest to a bank, after Edgeville's furnace. ==Bank== {{main|Bank}} Al Kharid's [[bank]] is to the south-west of the city. The bank is populated largely by [[Crafting|craftsmen]], [[Smithing|smiths]] and [[Cooking|chefs]], largely due to the proximity of the [[tanner]], [[range]] and [[furnace]]. In the [[Free-to-play|free worlds]], it often has many players buying and selling [[cowhide]]s. ==Shops== ===Zeke's Superior Scimitars=== [[File:Zeke's Superior Scimitars..png|thumb|300px|[[Zeke's Superior Scimitars]]]] {{main|Zeke's Superior Scimitars}} The [[scimitar]] [[shop]] is north-east of the [[bank]]. Stocks: *5 [[Bronze scimitar]]s *3 [[Iron scimitar]]s *2 [[Steel scimitar]]s *1 [[Mithril scimitar]] You can also ask for a [[dragon scimitar]]. If you do this, [[Zeke]] makes several puns regarding the [[Monkey Madness I]] [[quest]] required to buy a dragon scimitar: ''"The banana-brained nitwits who make them would never sell any to me. Seriously, you'll be a monkey's uncle before you hold a Dragon Scimitar."'' ===Dommik's Crafting Store.=== [[File:Dommik's Crafting Store..png|thumb|300px|[[Dommik's Crafting Store.]]]] {{main|Dommik's Crafting Store.}} The [[Crafting]] [[Shop|store]] is north-east of the [[Al Kharid Palace|palace]]. Stocks: *10 [[Chisel]]s *10 [[Ring mould]]s *10 [[Necklace mould]]s *10 [[Amulet mould]]s *3 [[Needle]]s *100 [[Thread]] *10 [[Holy mould]]s *10 ''[[Sickle mould]]s'' *10 [[Tiara mould]]s *10 ''[[Bolt mould]]s'' *10 [[Bracelet mould]]s ===Al-Kharid General Store=== [[File:Al-Kharid General Store.png|thumb|300px|[[Al-Kharid General Store]]]] {{main|Al-Kharid General Store}} The [[general store]] is east of the [[Al Kharid Palace|palace]]. Stocks: *5 [[Pot]]s *2 [[Jug]]s *5 [[Empty jug pack]]s *2 [[Shears]] *3 [[Bucket]]s *2 [[Bowl]]s *2 [[Cake tin]]s *3 [[Tinderbox]]es *2 [[Chisel]]s *5 [[Hammer]]s *5 [[Newcomer map]]s *5 [[Security book]] The [[shop]] is also often well-stocked with recently crafted leather armour. ===Louie's Armoured Legs Bazaar=== [[File:Louie's Armoured Legs Bazaar..png|thumb|300px|[[Louie's Armoured Legs Bazaar]]]] {{main|Louie's Armoured Legs Bazaar}} The [[Platelegs|plateleg]] [[Shop|store]] is south of the [[Al-Kharid General Store|general store]], east of the [[Al Kharid Palace|palace]]. Stocks: *5 [[Bronze platelegs]] *3 [[Iron platelegs]] *2 [[Steel platelegs]] *1 [[Black platelegs]] *1 [[Mithril platelegs]] *1 [[Adamant platelegs]] ===Ranael's Super Skirt Store=== [[File:Ranael's Super Skirt Store..png|thumb|300px|[[Ranael's Super Skirt Store]]]] {{main|Ranael's Super Skirt Store}} The [[plateskirt]] [[Shop|store]] is east of the [[Al Kharid Palace|palace]]. Stocks: *5 [[Bronze plateskirt]]s *3 [[Iron plateskirt]]s *2 [[Steel plateskirt]]s *1 [[Black plateskirt]] *1 [[Mithril plateskirt]] *1 [[Adamant plateskirt]] This shop stocks identical merchandise to [[Louie's Armoured Legs Bazaar]], except the [[armour]] is plateskirts, not [[platelegs]]. ===Kebab shop=== The [[kebab]] [[shop]] is at the [[range]] directly north of the bank, a kebab can be bought for 1 [[Coins|coin]] here. [[Karim]] is the kebab seller. ===Gem Trader=== [[File:Gem Trader..png|thumb|300px|[[Gem Trader]]]] {{main|Gem Trader}} The [[Gem Trader]] is to the north of Al Kharid, east of the gate to [[Lumbridge]]. Stock: *1 [[Uncut sapphire]]s *1 [[Uncut emerald]]s *0 [[Uncut ruby|Uncut rubies]] *0 [[Uncut diamond]]s *1 [[Sapphire]]s *1 [[Emerald]]s *0 [[Ruby|Rubies]] *0 [[Diamond]]s ===Silk trader=== The [[silk trader]] near the [[Zeke's Superior Scimitars|scimitar shop]] is a quick and easy way for newer [[members]] to gain small amounts of money. If the player is prepared to click through a lengthy dialogue, they can buy [[silk]] cheaply (3 [[coins]]) which can be sold for a profit at a [[general store]] other than the one in Al Kharid. :'''Note:''' If you refuse at the first time, he'll lower the price to 2 coins. ===Ali's Discount Wares.=== [[File:Ali's Discount Wares..png|thumb|300px|[[Ali's Discount Wares.]]]] {{main|Ali's Discount Wares.}} [[Ali Morrisane]] is found east of the [[gem trader]] to the north-east of the city near the blue star [[Quests|quest]] [[icon]] {{SCP|Quest}}. He sells various [[items]], and once [[The Feud]] is completed, he will open various other [[shop]]s if you set up merchanting opportunities for him. Talk to him (there is no 'trade' option) and select the ''"Ya, I'll get to it soon."'' option. When he asks ''"...Unless you want to make a small purchase from me first?"'', select ''"Ok"''. ==Sorceress's Garden== {{main|Sorceress's Garden}} The [[Sorceress's Garden]] is found in the south-east of Al Kharid. ==Al Kharid mine== {{main|Al Kharid mine}} The [[Al Kharid mine]] is found near the northern entrance to Al Kharid. ==Duel Arena== {{main|Duel Arena}} The [[Duel Arena]] is found north-east of Al Kharid. ==Clan Wars== {{main|Clan Wars}} [[Clan Wars]] was previously found east of Al Kharid, but has since moved to [[Ferox Enclave]]. In its place is [[Citharede Abbey]]. This includes a mine and 8 desert variant hillgiants. ==Miscellaneous features== *There is a [[cactus patch]] on the east side of the city, used in the [[Farming]] [[Skills|skill]]. *The [[Fire Altar]], used in the [[Runecraft]] skill is located just north of the [[Duel Arena]] *There is a [[furnace]] north of the [[bank]]. It is the fifth closest furnace to a bank in all of ''[[Old School RuneScape|RuneScape]]''. ==Quests== The following [[Quests]] can be started in Al Kharid: ===Free-to-play quests=== *[[Prince Ali Rescue]] may be started by speaking to [[Hassan|Chancellor Hassan]], who is in the southern room of the [[Al Kharid Palace|palace]] next to the [[bank]]. ===Members quests=== *[[Shadow of the Storm]] may be started by speaking to [[Father Reen]] who is standing south of the bank. *[[The Feud]] may be started by speaking to [[Ali Morrisane]] at his [[Ali's Discount Wares.|stall]]. ==Monsters== *[[Al-Kharid warrior]] *[[Man|Men]] and [[Woman|women]] *[[Scorpion]]s ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 16 July 2020 |update = Ferox Enclave |change = Clan wars has been moved from the hill east of Al Kharid to [[Ferox Enclave]]. }} {{Subject changes |date = 19 June 2014 |update = Clan Wars is here! |poll = Old School feature poll 19 |change = [[Clan Wars]] is added east of Al Kharid. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ==Trivia== *Al Kharid is likely a reference to Al-Khali, a similar fantasy-Arabian town, from Terry Pratchett's Discworld novels. *There was no bank in Al Kharid until the release of Members on [[27 February]] [[2002]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Al Kharid}}
